framework.interfaces
Interface GameState

public interface GameState

Exposes the state of the game currently being tested to the tester.

This class should be implemented by either your gameState, or a wrapper class. The tests will call these methods to change the state of your game, and make sure that the correct changes are made by the move interface.

This interface references players by integer. The integers used are to be from 0 to (NUM_PLAYERS - 1), with the order of the numbers matching the order of play.

It is the tester's responsibility to ensure that any state changes represent a legal gameState at the point where any move methods are called. Making moves on an invalid gameState will result in undefined behavior.

Method Detail

getWhoseTurn

int getWhoseTurn()
Get the current turn's player number

This method will return an integer between 0 and (NUM_PLAYERS - 1), as specified in the GameState interface.

Returns:
the number of the current player

setWhoseTurn

void setWhoseTurn(int player)
Set the current player.

This method sets which player is currently having a turn. Valid inputs are between 0 and (NUM_PLAYERS - 1) inclusive.

Parameters:
player - the player whose turn it will be

getDeck

java.util.List<Card> getDeck()
Gets the GameState's current deck.

The current deck of the GameState is to be returned as a List of Cards. The first item in the list is the next card that would be drawn from the deck, and so on.

Returns:
the current GameState deck

setDeck

void setDeck(java.util.List<Card> deck)
Sets the GameState's current deck.

The new deck of the GameState is to be given as a List of Cards. The first item in the list is the next card that would be drawn from the deck, and so on.

Parameters:
deck - the new deck of the GameState

getDiscard

java.util.List<Card> getDiscard()
Gets the GameState's current discard pile.

The current discard pile of the GameState is to be returned as a List of Cards. The first item in the list is the most recently discarded card, and so on.

Returns:
the current GameState discard pile

setDiscard

void setDiscard(java.util.List<Card> discard)
Sets the GameState's current discard pile.

The current discard pile of the GameState is to be given as a List of Cards. The first item in the list is the most recently discarded card, and so on.

Parameters:
discard - the new discard pile of the GameState

getPlayerSestertii

int getPlayerSestertii(int playerNum)
Gets a player's current Sestertii.

The current Sestertii (money) of the specified player is returned as an integer. Correct player indexing is discussed in the GameState interface header.

Parameters:
playerNum - which player's Sestertii to return
Returns:
the player's Sestertii

setPlayerSestertii

void setPlayerSestertii(int playerNum,
                        int amount)
Sets a player's current Sestertii.

The new Sestertii (money) of the specified player is given as an integer. Correct player indexing is discussed in the GameState interface header.

Parameters:
playerNum - which player's Sestertii to set
amount - the quantity of Sestertii for the player to have

getPlayerHand

java.util.Collection<Card> getPlayerHand(int playerNum)
Gets the contents of a player's current Hand.

The contents of the hand of the specified player is returned as an unordered collection of Cards. Correct player indexing is discussed in the GameState interface header.

Parameters:
playerNum - which player's hand cards to get
Returns:
the contents of the player's hand

getPlayerHand

                   java.util.Collection<Card> hand)

The contends of the hand of the specified player is given as an unordered collection of Cards. Correct player indexing is discussed in the GameState interface header.

Parameters:
playerNum - which player's hand cards to set
hand - the contents of the the player's hand

getPlayerCardsOnDiscs

Card[] getPlayerCardsOnDiscs(int playerNum)
Gets the cards currently laid on a player's dice discs.

The cards on the specified player's dice discs are returned in an array of length NUM_DICE_DISCS. The 0th index in the array represents the dice disc of value 1. Dice discs with no card are returned with Card.NOT_A_CARD as their value. Correct player indexing is discussed in the GameState interface header.

Parameters:
playerNum - which player's dice disc contents to get
Returns:
the cards currently on the player's dice discs

setPlayerCardsOnDiscs

void setPlayerCardsOnDiscs(int playerNum,
                           Card[] discCards)
Sets the contents of a player's dice discs.

The cards on the specified player's dice discs are given in an array of length NUM_DICE_DISCS. The 0th index in the array represents the dice disc of value 1. Dice discs with no card are returned with Card.NOT_A_CARD as their value. Correct player indexing is discussed in the GameState interface header.

Parameters:
playerNum - which player's cards to set
discCards - the cards to be placed on the dice discs

getActionDice

int[] getActionDice()
Gets the current player's action dice values.

The values of the current player's action dice are returned in an array in unspecified order. Dice are to be referred to by their value, not by their position in this array.

Returns:
the current player's dice

setActionDice

void setActionDice(int[] dice)
Sets the current player's action dice values.

The values of the current player's action dice are given in an array in unspecified order. Dice are to be referred to by their value, not by their position in this array.

Parameters:
dice - the new values of the current player's dice

getPoolVictoryPoints

int getPoolVictoryPoints()
Returns the number of Victory Points not currently held by a player.

The number of victory points not held by any player are returned. This method is included so that the total number of Victory Points in a game can be tested.

Returns:
the number of Victory Points not held by any player
